verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Yet will I bring one plague more upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt; afterwards he will let you go hence: when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out hence altogether.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "I will bring one more plague on Pharaoh and on Egypt. After that, he will let you leave. In fact, when he finally releases you, he will drive you out completely."

verses.kjv: Speak now in the ears of the people, and let every man borrow of his neighbour, and every woman of her neighbour, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold.
verses.ct: "Tell the people that every man and woman should ask their Egyptian neighbors for articles of silver and gold."

verses.kjv: And the LORD gave the people favour in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s servants, and in the sight of the people.
verses.ct: The LORD caused the Egyptians to look favorably on the Israelites. And Moses himself had become highly respected throughout Egypt — both among Pharaoh's officials and among the ordinary people.

verses.kjv: And Moses said, Thus saith the LORD, About midnight will I go out into the midst of Egypt:
verses.ct: Moses said, "This is what the LORD says: 'Around midnight, I will pass through the middle of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first born of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even unto the firstborn of the maidservant that is behind the mill; and all the firstborn of beasts.
verses.ct: Every firstborn son in the land of Egypt will die — from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne, all the way down to the firstborn of the slave woman grinding at the mill, along with every firstborn among the livestock.

verses.kjv: And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there was none like it, nor shall be like it any more.
verses.ct: There will be anguished wailing throughout all of Egypt, worse than anything that has ever been heard before or will ever be heard again.

verses.kjv: But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog move his tongue, against man or beast: that ye may know how that the LORD doth put a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.
verses.ct: But among the Israelites, not even a dog will bark at any person or animal. This will show you that the LORD makes a clear distinction between the Egyptians and Israel.'"

verses.kjv: And all these thy servants shall come down unto me, and bow down themselves unto me, saying, Get thee out, and all the people that follow thee: and after that I will go out. And he went out from Pharaoh in a great anger.
verses.ct: "Then all these officials of yours will come to me and bow down before me, begging, 'Leave! Take all the people who follow you and go!' After that, I will leave." Then Moses stormed out of Pharaoh's presence, burning with anger.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you; that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: The LORD had told Moses, "Pharaoh will refuse to listen to you, so that my miraculous signs will be multiplied throughout Egypt."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: and the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron performed all these miraculous signs in front of Pharaoh, but the LORD made Pharaoh's heart stubborn, and he would not let the Israelites leave his country.
